title: Visual aids for selling typographic redesign.
content:
Hi gang,

I’m trying to sell my director of marketing and head of company (neither of them typographic or even particularly visual people) on the idea of spending thousands of dollars for a typographic update. I’d love to have in my back pocket a few examples of typographic redesigns (before and after shots) that really show the idea of small changes making a big difference. I seem to remember seeing someone’s site who redesigned a lot of newspaper mastheads...

So please throw me some urls. Titling fonts rather than text is more appropriate, brands rather than magazines/newspapers are more appropriate. Subtle changes are best, but the ’wow’ factor of the After pic being way nicer than the Before, even to untrained eyes, is key.

Thanks!  
-obsolete
